content: supposedly doing fractions up in the apple tree under the boughs daisy screeched after them to bring her the cows i always imagine montgomery living in a world of apple trees in anne of the island mrs lynde writes to anne mentioning that she s about to start another quilt mrs silas sloane has a handsome new apple-leaf pattern this is the first mention of the apple-leaf pattern but there is perhaps an implication that there are multiple apple-leaf patterns and mrs sloane simply has a new one in any case women were clearly sharing patterns there are further references to quilts in the novel both patchwork and knitted phil refers to quilting parties diana receives one of mrs lynde s tobacco-stripe quilts upon her marriage and mrs lynde supplies anne with an armful of quilts to keep her warm at patty s place a tobacco-millionaire even attempts to purchase the tulip-patterned quilt as his mother made quilts just like it anne refuses but mrs lynde is delighted by his interest and sends him one of her spares these tulip quilts appear to be patchworked workbasket magazine does publish a knitted tulip-pattern counterpane in 1945 and there s mention of a knitted tulip triangle in a 1922 issue of weekly times but it s more likely a patchwork pattern as mrs lynde is as prolific in patchwork as in knitting in anne of windy poplars 1936 we learn that mrs lynde s new patchwork quilt just completed containing five thousand pieces was on display and received its meed of praise but certainly the apple-leaf is knitted as indicated by mrs lynde and she continued to knit cotton-warp quilts for in rainbow valley 1919 we learn she was spending the leisure of her old age in knitting cotton-warp quilts against the day when anne s daughters should need a setting-out she is basically an excellent all-round craftswoman mrs lynde tells us her favorite patterns in anne s house of dreams promising anne tobacco- stripe and apple-leaf bedspreads as a wedding gift the tobacco-stripe pattern still evades me but could be a reference to a then-popular colour tobacco a tobacco-hued cotton may have formed stripes - many of the counterpanes were based upon strips of knitting although on the other hand it could simply be another leaf pattern nonetheless mrs lynde proclaims the apple-leaf the loveliest pattern once married anne returns to green gables in anne of ingleside 1939 and we learn on the first page that one of mrs lynde s apple-leaf spreads still adorns her old bedroom at green gables anne s fondness for the pattern and its meaning to her is evident we know montgomery was a knitter working quilts herself so surely she wasn t plucking the patterns out of thin air indeed montgomery writes about knitting a quilt in january 1914 when she s working on anne of the island she s starting a third quilt writing in her journal of a particular pattern bringing her fond
